strTitle: An Introduction to Freediving, Meditation, and Yoga

strIntroduction: The Balinese have once again proved their versatility and creative spirit, marrying Western motifs with indigenous materials. Spend a few hours with our master carvers crafting wonderful bamboo objects - like dragonflies that float on a pinpoint of contact between insect and earth. The carved forms are simple and spare; a minimalist approach that is a far cry from the traditional Balinese ‘Baroque’ art that pervades the island. Take a half day and challenge yourself to carve your own bamboo art work; and when you return home, you’ll want to stain or paint your new art piece as a final touch! We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Learn Bamboo Carving

strIntroduction: It might be not so popular hobby for some because of the activity called basket weaving, bamboo weaving has actually been practiced by the Chinese thousands of years ago. This has then applied by many people in different countries all over the world. Products of bamboo weaving include musical instruments, armors, and daily wares used for domestic and industrial use such as baskets, flower vases, floor mats, and among many others. None of those finished products of bamboo weaving you can see in supermarkets and malls had it not been for the craftsmen. These experts are the ones responsible for the popularity of weaved products all over the world. While those experts are abundant in China, many countries also have the experts in this activity and provide different kinds of bamboo weaved products. Since this kind of art activity cannot be produced by ordinary artists due to the long process of the methods, those who want to learn this fascinating art can enrol in one of the reputable art workshops. So if you’re in Bali, and want to become an expert in weaving bamboos, we have experts who can teach you from the fundamentals to the most complicated methods. This kind of art activity involves many painstaking tasks. You need some experts in order for you to be educated on how to apply the proper ways in weaving bamboos. Our art workshop in Bali is where students can not just learn all about bamboo weaving, but also apply the technique first hand. We have complete high end tools and equipment on how to finish a beautiful bamboo-weaved masterpiece. We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Try your Hand at Bamboo Weaving

strIntroduction: Stone carving, like wood carving, is a fascinating activity to undertake. Throughout history, man has taken this most durable natural element and produced the world’s most famous artworks. Even today, individuals devote their entire careers to crafting art from stone. Let W.S. Art Studio offer you a first opportunity to be introduced to the art form the ancient Greeks considered the highest expression of human creativity. If your travels bring you to Bali, one of the first things you’ll notice is the innumerable carved stone statuary adorning every temple, hotel, villa and private residence here. These works of art run the gamut of human creativity; from centuries-old massive stone temple ‘guardians’ carved into hillsides to intricately carved cement deities and gods. Our master carvers have worked in both wood and stone carving over the course of their individual careers. In Bali, one might interrupt a normal day’s wood carving at the family gallery to take time to work as part of a team of carvers employed by a temple or a new business concern to carve Bali-Hindu deities or animistic spirits, in either stone or cement. These hand-crafted creatures and creations live on as adornment for Hindu places of worship, or to decorate “Balinese-style” an entrepreneur’s new store or hotel. Our teacher-carvers will expertly introduce the curious student to the tools and techniques used to craft a personal piece of three-dimensional stone art. In just 3 hours we’ll help the beginner student produce their first bas-relief stone carving. How often does one get the chance to explore, hands-on, the stone carving experience? Skip the pool for the afternoon and join us at the W. S. Art Studio to flex your “Renaissance” art muscle. Let’s see what you can carve into a stone canvas! We have two slots everyday, a morning slot and an afternoon slot: - Morning Class: 10am - Afternoon Class: 2pm
strTitle: Craft your own Bas-Relief Stone Carving

strIntroduction: The Tantra Healing Yoga lesson I hold is a personalized approach based on the Ananda Marga Tantra yoga. These sessions may include a brief sharing, followed by sanskrit (the universal language of vibration) therapy through singing mantras or prabhatsamgiit, kirtan with spiritual movement and sadhana meditation, kaoshiki and tandava spiritual dance therapy, tantra flow yoga, classic ananda marga yoga and close with savasana, relaxation. Guests will deepen their practice of yoga and learn more about appreciating life and its simple graces.
strTitle: Practice Tantra Healing Yoga

strIntroduction: Bali is a world surfing mecca and has developed into a bustling epicenter where surfers either start or end their world surfing 'surfaries'. Until now very few learn to surf programs have been established in Bali. The Bali Learn to Surf School, as the first surf school in Bali, has embraced this opportunity, developing a highly professional outfit teaching people the experience of surfing ensuring that surf etiquette, surf safety and minimal impact to the ocean and surrounding land environments is bestowed upon the students taking part. Our Local and international guide will take you to the best spots on Bali (secret spots included) we take the hassle out of travel and the dangers out of surfing a new reefbreak for the first time, so all you have to think about is your next wave. Whether you’re a beginner or seasoned pro, come explore Bali's best beaches and surf breaks on our Surfari!
strTitle: Join a Surfari and Discover Bali's Hidden Surf Spots

strIntroduction: Every day we are active in my studio making masks, teaching children about mask dances on Sunday, and practicing music (gamelan) three times a week at night. We go to many cities for performances, mask exhibitions and work shops. In the traditional Malang mask dance we tell Panji stories. They are about princes and princesses from the two kingdoms in Java, before Singhasari Kingdom we called it Kadiri kingdom and Jenggolo Kingdom, but the two kingdoms had an enemy kingdom from the outside, whose king’s name was Klono Sewandono. King Klono did not like the other two kingdoms, which had more rice and more beautiful women, and wanted to take rice from the two kingdoms. Panji stories have a lot of characters. There are 76 characters in all! Watch our performance on Sundays, or join our inspiring workshops during the week. You will learn Mask-making, Traditional dance and Balinese music!
strTitle: Learn Traditional Javanese Crafts: Mask Making and Dancing

strIntroduction: インドネシアの中でもおいしいと有名なコーヒー豆のとれるフローレス島で、自分でコーヒーを炒ってみませんか？ この体験では、コーヒーの生豆を選別するところから試飲まで。 炒りたてのコーヒーをその場でお試しいただけます。 香り豊かな自分だけのオリジナルコーヒーに、コーヒー好きなあなたなら必ず感動していただけると思います。 焙煎後は、まみー特製スウィーツとともに、コーヒーブレイクをお楽しみいただけます。 ご希望であれば、地元の市場にてコーヒーの生豆をさらに購入することができます。 一緒にローカルな市場の散策はいかかでしょうか。 お気軽にご連絡ください！
strTitle: フローレス・コーヒーの自家焙煎

strIntroduction: Nasi Goreng（インドネシアの炒飯）にはつきもののKerupuk（揚げせんべい） 実は、色も形もいろんな種類があります。 成分によって味もそれぞれ。 Warung（インドネシアの食堂）で食べるときには、揚げられて数時間ないしは数日前のものが出てきたりして、時には湿気てることもありますが、揚げたてがやっぱり一番おいしいです。 私たちはインドネシア人と日本人の国際家庭で、子供たちは片言の日本語を話します。そんな我が家でKerupukを作り、食べ比べをしましょう。 また、小さなことですがKerupukを揚げるコツなどもございます。簡単な説明を加えながら実習、試食を共にしてみませんか？ ご希望であれば、地元の市場にてKerupukを購入することができます。 一緒に市場の散策もいかかでしょうか。 お気軽にご連絡下さい！
strTitle: クルプックの食べ比べに挑戦

strIntroduction: 韓国でもおなじみのよもぎ蒸しが、インドネシアにもあります。 その名も Spa-V （Vは、Vaginaの略。あからさまに言うのを避けるために頭文字だけをとっているのだとか。） 穴の開いた椅子（上記写真）に座って、椅子の下には「ハーブのスモーク」 てるてるぼうずマントをかぶって女性のデリケートな部分を蒸されること約半時間。 体の芯からじんわりと温まります。 いろいろな婦人病、下半身の冷えなどに効果抜群です。 社交的ジャワ人のIbu（婦人）が経営するサロンKingshe で、Ibuとの世間話に花を咲かせつつ心休まるひと時を過ごしてみませんか？
strTitle: ルーテンのローカルサロンでSpa-V

strIntroduction: バリ島よりも、もっと東に位置するフローレス島で、インドネシアの素朴な日常生活を体験してみませんか？ 私たちはインドネシア人と日本人の国際家庭で、インドネシア人カップルの家庭とはやっぱりちょっと違います。 それでも、そこがまたユニークな部分でもあり、子供たちは片言の日本語を話します。 ＜食の体験＞ 食事も、インドネシア料理はもちろんですが、日本料理や韓国料理をはじめ、時にはパスタを食べたり、インドのナンなどを作ることもありますし、その日の気分で臨機応変に変化をもたらすことができます。 （ちなみに、こちらに住む多くの方たちは、毎日揚げ物がメインです。豆腐、魚、肉、とにかく揚げます。） マンガライ料理・・・Jangtong Pisang（バナナの花）, Daun ubi（タピオカの葉っぱ）, Labu Jepang（はやと瓜）,Ikan kering（魚の干物）、Kelapa（ココナツ）などを使って 日本食（和食）・・・焼き魚、煮物、味噌汁など。 日本食（洋食）・・・コロッケ、マカロニサラダ、スープなど。 韓国料理・・・プルコギ、チヂミ、ナムルなど。 その他、お客様のニーズに合わせて、一緒にお食事を作ることができます。 しかし、ほとんどの材料は市場での購入になり、お米はTapis と言ってお米の中にあるもみ殻を取り除く作業が必要ですし、鶏肉は鶏の解体から始まります。 ＜フローレスのキリスト教に触れる体験＞ インドネシアはイスラム大国ですが、フローレス島ではカトリック教徒が約80％と言われています。それゆえあちらこちらに教会もあります。 ここには、巨大なショッピングモールや特別のエンターテイメントを楽しむようなそんな施設があるわけではなく、日々の宗教的活動が、人々の生活に密着した余暇活動となっていることがあります。そういう活動に集い、参加しながら、お友達と会い、共に食事をし、おしゃべりをしたりするのを楽しんでいます。 私達が親しくさせていただいているべテル教会は、島内でも少数派のプロテスタント系ですが、新規の参加者も喜んで迎え入れてくれます。 日曜日・・・日曜礼拝 朝7:30～約3時間 火または水曜日・・・聖書を中心に数人での証会 夜8:00～約2時間 金曜日・・・Ruteng Blessing （ミサ） 夜7:00～約2時間 月1で女性のための集い 夜7:00～約2時間 その他、クリスマスやイースターを中心とするキリスト教的メイン行事。ゲストスピーカーを迎えての講演会など多種。 インドネシアにおける宗教と人々との生活とのつながりを直接肌で感じることができますし、雰囲気を知るだけでもなかなか日本の日常にはない経験となるのではないでしょうか。 ＜中国系インドネシア人の商売について触れる体験＞ インドネシア人と言えど、夫は中国系。考え方や社会環境もかなり違います。小さい規模ではありますが、私たちが経営する生活雑貨のお店で、インドネシアの流通経済について考えてみるのはいかがでしょうか。 日本ではほとんどがスーパーマーケットなどのように、多彩な商品がすでに展示されている中を、各自の好みや必要に合わせて購入するシステムが当たり前となっていますが、インドネシアの小売店では、多くがマンツーマンで接客をします。 接客の態度も日本では「お客様は神様です！」みたいに扱われるかと思いますが、買っていくお客の方が「ありがとう」と言って帰っていく方が多いのです。 また、町の中の問屋さんに私と一緒に支払いに行くとか、仕入れに行くなどといったことも可能です。 問屋も商品によっていろいろあります。そういうお店に入って商品を見定めたり、私が説明したりもできますし、 今までは買うだけでしかなかった価値観が変わること間違いありません。 どうぞお気軽にご連絡ください！
strTitle: インドネシアの片田舎でホームステイ

strIntroduction: Enjoy the luxurious Balinese Spa Massage crafted by blending the natural ingredients selection and inspired by traditional Asian therapies connected with modern beauty recipes. "Ocean Breeze" Refresh Body Treatment, 90 min You will enjoy the warming up massage, which will make your body relaxed. After that you will be treated to Organic Sea Salt Scrub - for a perfectly smooth skin. Finally, Cool & Refresh Total Body Menthol Massage will make you rejuvenated and ready for more adventures in Bali. Our spa is overlooking the ocean, which will make it even easier for you to find the balance of mind,body and spirit. Feel the energy of the ocean and the breath of the air purified by the miracle Neem tree. PLEASE NOTE: If you require round trip transportation, please let us know your location and hotel name and we can send you a price quote for one of our staff to pick and drop you off.
strTitle: Rejuvenate your Body at a Spa Overlooking the Ocean

strIntroduction: A must do snorkeling trip while you are in Bali. The pristine corals and warm waters are home to schools of vibrantly colored fish like the emperor angel fish, parrot fish, turtles, Morray eels in this areas. Marine Survey has revealed over 300 species of tropical fish around the island!! We have local snorkeling guides who will help you with your equipment and life jackets. Flotation devices will also be provided for those that are not so comfortable in the water. Our specially designated snorkeling areas make snorkeling in Lembongan a safe and enjoyable activity for all ages. The snorkel sites you will visit: 1. WALL BAY Famous for its excellent visibility of up to 40m+ on a good day. The highlight of your trip with healthy live coral reef, Big Fish like GT “Giant Travelly”, Barracuda and hundreds of fish of all shapes and sizes 2. JETTY The boat ride out to JETTY Nusa Penida is almost as exciting as the snorkeling trip itself, as it offers divers incredible views of the towering sea cliffs of Nusa Penida. Various Tropical Fish can be found and sometime Mola mola can be found here 3. MANGROVE BAY This snorkel site sprawling coral garden with plenty of fish and very light currents. You will see big sponges, nudibranch, mantis shrimps, cowries, cleaner shrimps & moray eels. Shoals of colorful anthias cover the corals, trigger fish, puffer fish, etc. ITINERARY: - 7.30-8.30 : Pickup from your hotel Lobby Kuta, Seminyak, Jimbaran, Nusa Dua, Uluwatu area. (7.30am if you are in Ubud area and 8.30am Sanur area) - 9.15 : Depart from Sanur by fast boat. - 10.30 - 12.30 : Snorkeling sessions at 1-2 different spots (approx. 30-60 min in each location) depending on the water conditions. - 12.30 - 13.30 : Lunch at the Restaurant on Beach - 13.30 - 14.00 : Mangrove tour using traditional boat - 14.00 - 15.30 : another Snorkeling Session - 16.00 : Depart from Nusa Lembongan by fast boat. - 17.00 : Return transfer to your hotel. LUNCH MENU : - Mineral Water during Snorkling trip - Seafood with rice (Vegetarian items possible on request) - Juice/soft drink If you are not a confident swimmer or don't know how to swim at all, no worries! Life vests are provided and our instructors will guide you to make sure you feel 100% safe and comfortable.
strTitle: 25% OFF One Day Bali Snorkeling Trip & Nusa Lembongan Tour

strIntroduction: Hotel Tugu Bali, standing silent against the warm glow of the setting sun, is a poet’s dream comes true. It is where the wind whispers romantic tales of ancient kingdoms and eternal love stories. Book your rustic bed, located right at our private grassy lawn. You will both be tucked in for a little private gourmet picnic under the moonlight. Two blindfolds accompany your delicious desserts for some added spice to your meal. NOTE ABOUT THE OPTIONS: - You can select the 'shared beach' option which allows other couples to be on the other beds and tables should there be other booking that happens to fall on the same evening. Rest assured that while we call it the 'shared' option, each of the beds has its own corner on our lawn and are situated at a distance of at least meters away from the other beds, so you will still enjoy plenty of privacy. Many of our guests choose this option and love it just as much! If you'd like to make your night extra special, here are some additional arrangements we can organize to surprise that special someone (you can include these add-ons in the booking page): - A special Rejang Dance with 6 child dancers (accompanied by recorded music) - A special Oleg dance with one male and one female dancer (accompanied by recorded music) - A live Balinese Gamelan - A single classical/jazz violonist to play in the background during your dinner (2 hours) - 2 players of Bambu Rindik instruments (1 hour) - An extra 10 heart-shaped candles for an extra romantic touch - A solo guitarist in the background - Little girls to surprise your lady with a ring (for that unforgettable proposal!) - Rose petals everywhere OPTION 1: PICNIC MENU - Crab Cocktail with Avocado, Coconut, Chili Seeds and Fresh Lime - Gazpacho Andaluz Traditional Spanish chilled tomato, cucumber and red pepper soup - L’Amour, Underwater Prawns flambéed in calvados and honey & grilled scallops in fragrant herbs served with ginger sauce OR - Aphrodisiac Truffle Parcels Light filo pastry parcels, filled with mushrooms fricassee, pan roasted duck breast and truffle oil - Served With: Warm Baby Potato Salad With crispy anchovies, bacon, virgin olive oil and rosemary & Simply-Grilled Baby Asparagus - Desserts Blindfolded Surprises a selection of four desserts to be tasted blindfolded **************************************** OPTION 2: BEEF MENU - Duck and Pear Salad with Sesame Dressing - Grilled Beef Steak Imported beef steak in cabernet tarragon jus - Served with: Warm Baby Potato Salad With crispy anchovies, bacon, virgin olive oil and rosemary & Simply-Grilled Baby Asparagus - Desserts Blindfolded Surprises a selection of four desserts to be tasted blindfolded **************************************** OPTION 3: CHICKEN MENU - Roasted Pumpkin Salad with Feta Cheese With roasted capsicum, pumpkin seeds, arugula, alfalfa, Bean sprout & glazed balsamic dressing - Chicken Involtini Wrapped chicken fillet stuffed with ham, mozzarella cheese, zucchini, carrot, stringbeans and served with garlic fettuccini, tomato concasse and green peas - Served With: Warm Baby Potato Salad With crispy anchovies, bacon, virgin olive oil and rosemary & Simply-Grilled Baby Asparagus - Desserts Blindfolded Surprises a selection of four desserts to be tasted blindfolded **************************************** OPTION 4: VEGETARIAN MENU - Sesame & Ginger Tempeh Salad Mixed greens, cucumber & baby tomatoes - Gazpacho Andaluz Traditional Spanish chilled tomato, cucumber and red pepper soup - Spinach Mousse Tortellini Crisp-fried with shiitake and vodka sauce OR - Tahu Masak Kare Nonyah Stir fried tofu with curry sauce and assorted vegetable with white & turmeric spiced rice - Served with: Warm Baby Potato Salad With crispy anchovies, bacon, virgin olive oil and rosemary & Simply-Grilled Baby Asparagus - Blindfolded surprises A selection of four desserts to be tasted blindfolded, to send your taste buds to a world of oblivion ALSO INCLUDED: - One complimentary welcome drink per person from our cocktail menu (could be a glass of house wine, local beer, a mocktail, etc but excludes champagne & sparkling wine) - Free flow of water to be served in glasses ***PLEASE NOTE: In the event that it rains, guests hereby agree to have it at one of our indoor private romantic dining venues.
strTitle: Aphrodisiac Picnic in Bed - Sunset Romance on the Beachfront

strIntroduction: When you arrive, we will present you with a catalogue so you can choose an outfit from an abundant collection for women, men, and even matching outfits for couples. With a wide range of traditional Balinese wedding outfits and dancing outfits in all colors and styles, you will be spoilt for choice! Our comfortable studio is fully air-conditioned, with a variety of background sets to add variety to your photos. We employ a very professional lighting crew, cameraman, as well as make-up artists, who will put you at ease as we prepare for your big moment in the spotlight! Regardless of age, gender or figure, everyone can enjoy this experience. There are no size restrictions with Balinese clothing. All you need is 1 hour of time (more if you want to think about your outfits) and we can get you on your way! You can enjoy this experience on your own with our individual package, or as a couple with our King & Queen package. After your photoshoot, the finished CD with 30-40 photos and 12 printed photos will be delivered to your hotel by the next day (alternatively, you can wait 1 hour in the area and come back for it). With this convenient CD of carefully mastered and enhanced photos, you can modify and reprint your photographs as you desire! This allows you to keep a permanent album from which you can modify and print your own photos, whenever you want! If you are staying in Ubud, we can provide you a special Kuta Stroll tour for USD50. After we take your pictures, we will take you to wherever you like in the southern part of Kuta. (vicinity of Kuta Square, Seminyak district and Legian Street) We bring you back to the studio after we meet at the promised meeting point after a several hour stroll, you will then receive you completed CD photo album, and then we take you back to your hotel in Ubud. Please book your start time between 8am and 8pm, available daily! *Free shuttle service from Kuta, Legian, Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Sanur and the southern part of Seminyak with minimum of 2 person booking.
strTitle: Get Photographed in an Authentic Balinese Outfit

strIntroduction: The private castaway experience is a complete haven of relaxation and one of the best things to do from Bali. Named because of its crystal clear waters, Crystal Bay in Penida Island will welcome you to its shores. Take the opportunity to snorkel over some of Indonesia’s best coral reefs, enjoy a tropical BBQ lunch under the palms and visit a rustic village to watch traditional Balinese wood carvers and sarong weavers at work. During your trip, you will also have the opportunity to taste the local cuisine, and meet the islanders as they make flower offerings for their temple. During the day, you can enjoy a massage or simply relax in a hammock overlooking the bay’s tranquil, tropical waters. This castaway cruise is Bali’s original private beach cruising experience. We operate from Benoa harbor to Crystal Bay, Penida Island every Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday between 1st April- 31st October. PICK UP TIMES: 07.15 - 07.30: Ubud / Tanah Lot 07.30 - 07.45: Seminyak/ Legian/ Bukit/ Ulutwatu / Canggu 07.45 - 08.00: Kuta / Tuban / Nusa Dua / Jimbaran 08.00 - 08.15: Sanur ITINERARY: Arrive at Benoa Harbour 08:40 am - Board the catamaran. Morning coffee/tea and pastries served. 09:00 am - Set sail to Crystal Bay, Penida Island. Mineral water, soft drinks and fresh fruit will be available onboard. 11:00 am - Arrival at Crystal Bay. Our cruise director will briefs guests about Penida Island and it's inhabitants, temples and the schedule for your village tour and snorkeling. 11:30 - 12:30 - Snorkeling program: if conditions are favorable, guests may snorkel all day in Crystal Bay. 12:30 - 14:00 pm Tropical BBQ Lunch. 14:00 - 14:45 pm - Village tour, see Coconut plantation, Wood carving, Ikat weaving and more. 15:45 pm - Head count and return to catamaran. 16:00 pm - Get 'rescued' and sail back to 'reality' to Benoa Harbour. 18:00 pm - The catamaran arrives at Benoa harbour. Transfer back to hotel / accommodation.
strTitle: Castaway Cruise to Penida Island on a Luxury Catamaran

strIntroduction: Harness the power of the wind as you kitesurf across the ocean and skate over Bali's world renowned waves. This kitesurfing lesson will be held in Sanur lagoon, known to offer water conditions suitable for all levels - flat waters in the lagoon for beginners to rolling waves over the reefs for more advanced kite surfers. 1km wide and 7km long, Sanur lagoon and its warm, clear tropical waters is the perfect place to kitesurf. We will start with the basics in the classroom, to understand wind patterns and the handling skills required, including step by step video demonstrations. After a thorough introductory session, we will move to the beach for a preliminary course in kite handling and safety before taking to the waves. Level 1 - Essential Basic Kitesurfing This introductory course is designed to familiarize first time kiters with all the equipment needed, complete kite set-up & handling methods, safety systems, and essential knowledge of wind patterns and water conditions. You will learn how to launch the kite and try out the trainer kite flying equipment on the beach. Level 2 - Water Control (Body Dragging & Board Starts) Take your kite surfing to the next level – put your training to work by getting wet with the kite! You will learn how to water launch and park the kite safely in neutral position above you, then use it to move around in the water. "Body dragging skills" include moving upwind for board recovery, propelling left and right slowly and with speed to fully understand the power zone and kite dynamics. After these excercises, you will learn how to get onto the board, and how to use it and the kite correctly to get yourself out of the water to start riding! Level 3 – Riding Time to bring all the training together. This 1.5 hour course using a boat on the lagoon teaches you to further control your water starts, generate & adjust riding speed. We will correct your riding position and kite movements, gaining you consistency in kitesurfing. Learn about 'Edging' the board; riding upwind, downwind and changing direction. As your riding advances, we will work more on turns - and if you're ready, try getting some air - jumping and freestyle aerial action!
strTitle: Kitesurf Across Bali's Waves

strIntroduction: Traditional Balinese healing therapy by a Balian (Balinese healer) has been an important part of Bali's Bali's culture for centuries. Traditional healing techniques and divine healing have been used to treat both mental and physical illnesses. If you seek physical, mental, or emotional healing, you can book a consultation with Guru Made Sumantra. He will first assess what illnesses your body has by looking at your tongue. Following, he will determine which healing method to use on your body. It may range from using herbal medicine ("LohLoh"), massage techniques (similar to foot reflexology), yoga, or energy transfer. Guru Made Sumantra may use mudrahs (Hindu ritual gestures), draw patterns on your body, spit chewed herbs on your skin, apply scented oils, poke you with sharp sticks, or give you a deep tissue massage that will be painful. Most people howl from the pain, but you will feel better after it. SOME HEALING TECHNIQUES: -Reiki Healing Reiki is a Japanese technique for stress reduction and relaxation. It is based on the idea that an unseen “life force energy” flows through us and is what causes us to be alive. If one’s “life force energy” is low, then we are more likely to get sick or feel stress. During the treatment, you will feels a wonderful glowing radiance flowing through and around you. Reiki treats the body, emotions, mind, and spirit, creating many beneficial effects such as relaxation and feelings of peace & security. Reiki is a simple, natural and safe method of spiritual healing and self-improvement that everyone can use. It also works in conjunction with all other medical or therapeutic techniques to relieve side effects and promote recovery. -Pranic Healing Pranic healing is an energy healing technique based on the overall structure of the human body. According to pranic healing, our body is composed of two parts - the visible physical body, and the invisible energy body called the bioplasmic body or aura. Our aura is the invisible luminous energy body, which penetrates the visible physical body and extends beyond it. Pranic healing utilizes prana or life energy and the chakras (energy centers) to heal diseased energy levels. The healing process involves manipulation of the patient’s chakras, bio energy and aura. -Yoga Healing Yoga’s primary emphasis is on general well-being. Although yoga is beneficial for a variety of conditions, it is not considered a therapy for specific illnesses. Rather, yoga employs a broad holistic approach that focuses on teaching people about a new lifestyle, way of thinking, and way of being in the world. By improving, regaining or retaining general good health, a person's specific difficulties tend to disappear. Many of the healing effects of yoga is clinically verified, such as relieving stress & fatigue, invigoration, vitality, anti-aging properties, and relaxation. -Ayurveda Healing Ayurveda is a science that is widely acknowledged as the world’s oldest medical system. It is an oral tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation. In Ayurveda, we find meaning and purpose in living in harmony with cosmic life. When physical and physiologycal processes are weak, it allows toxic impurities to form and the body gets blocked. To remedy this situation, Ayurveda offers the gift of “panchakarma”, or “The science of rejuvenation”. In this process, the body is purified of the degenerative influences of these foreign substances, thus freeing the body to naturally exerise its inherent rejuvenating abilities. The main objective of Ayurveda is to correct the imbalance of the forces of “vatha”, “pittha” and “kapha”. "Vatha" is the functional intelligence in the body that governs movements, transportation, drying and separating.“Pittha" governs all metabolic processes. "Kapha" governs cohesion, and internal phlegm. -Kundalini Healing Kundalini healing involves the healer doing a comprehensive energy analysis, chakra (energy points) and aura readings on your body to determine how to bring your body into balance. The healer will then help you to create a focused program to strengthen your practice and achieve your goals.
strTitle: Heal Your Body with Spiritual Balinese Healing Therapy

strIntroduction: Explore the world of bamboo with us in this journey through the luxurious private Bamboo Mansions in Green Village that's built entirely without nails, the renowned Green School campus, and the world's biggest bamboo chocolate factory. MORNING TOUR (starts at 10am) - available Mon - Fri This half day tour begins at 10am with a stop at our design workshop, the largest bamboo factory in Bali, where we show you how freshly harvested bamboo is processed to produce a variety of products ranging from furniture to soap. After marvelling at the fascinating process, we take a short ride to step into the luxurious private residences at Green Village. See first hand the finished product of master Balinese craftsmen and the advanced innovation of sustainable architecture, all clustered around a sleepy river valley surrounded by forests and rice fields. These houses are made entirely of bamboo, with elegant public spaces, custom furniture (made of bamboo of course!) and well-appointed rooms. Everyone in your travelling party will love their unique spaces and we guarantee that a stroll through any one of our house will have you tempted to stay here the next time you're in Bali (some of our guests even book these houses for a few months!) AFTERNOON TOUR (starts at 12.30pm) - available Mon - Fri Same as the morning tour itinerary but with an additional visit to Green School, a natural, holistic, student-centered learning environment that empowers and inspires its students to be creative, innovative, green leaders. Created by master craftsmen, designers and builders, landscape architects and gardeners using a blend of cutting-edge technology and traditional materials and methods, the school is a truly inspirational teaching and learning environment that has earned it the award for "Greenest School on Earth" in 2012. ARCHITECTURAL MODEL MAKING COURSE (to be added with a half day tour) - available Mon - Fri In this unique to Bali course you will learn to make a bamboo architectural model taught in the very heart of the bamboo factory. This distinct process of creating scaled structural models made of hand-whittled bamboo sticks is one of its kind in the world. The models are then digitally replicated in 3D lines for engineers to study before a project is finalized. Take a timeless skill away from Bali with you, and come learn this unique process in a 2-hour modeling class!
strTitle: Visit Bali's Famous Bamboo Mansions and Design Workshop

strIntroduction: This will be a truly unforgettable experience, where you will have a chance to explore breathtaking beauty of Bali's East coast by Canoe or Sea Kayaking. The Amed area is known for its unspoiled coral reefs and snorkeling. It is full of scenic vistas. You will enjoy seeing that tropical paradise in a quiet environment, at your own pace. Relax, unwind, feel the stunning scenery, ocean breezes and coastal villages with all your senses. Snorkel with the myriad of colorful, tropical fish living among the vivid coral reef at one of the following times: Sunrise: 6:00 - 10:00am Morning: 8:30am - 12:30pm Sunset: 2:30 - 6:30pm This is not just a Canoe or Kayak experience. This is truly a mind, body and spirit adventure!
strTitle: Explore the East Coast of Bali (Amed) by Canoe or Sea Kayak

strIntroduction: From rustic beach bars to upscale chic lounges to deep-house clubs with world-class sound systems - Bali is renowned for its nightlife scene - However, unless you venture out to the sleazy bars of Kuta, Bali's nightlife is largely event based and is sometimes not so obvious to a new visitor. If you do not know where to go on a particular day - it can end up being a pretty anti-climatic experience. Our nightlife tour is not like a pub crawl in other cities where they promise you the best clubs yet you end up at very uninspiring locations with cheap shots. Our tour will take you to the absolute best places in Bali. Our knowledgeable guide will have all the hook-ups that are needed for an amazing night-out. We know where all the hot spots are each night so you will be well taken care of - All you need to do is show up! Saying that, the tour is customizable according to your preferences and tastes in music - so if there is something you absolutely love or hate - please do let us know! Meet-up Time - 5.00 PM* *Meet-up time is flexible - no rush. Please let us know what time suits you best!
strTitle: Experience Bali's Nightlife with an Insider's Tour

strIntroduction: Our family welcomes you to join us for a cooking session and dinner in our house in Bali! We are local Balinese people and we enjoy sharing our culture with you. And what better way is there, that doing that over a meal? You will cook with my wife, who is the best cook in the world! Together, you will prepare the delicious and authentic Balinese food. Balinese cuisine is much more than just Nasi Goreng! We can discuss what to make exactly, depending on your preferences and allergies. After preparing the meal we will all eat dinner together. We will be happy to share our stories and culture with you and we hope we can learn from each other! So you will have a chance to learn a new cuisine and also to share a great experience with us. We hope to see you soon!
strTitle: Cook and Eat Delicious Lunch in a Balinese House

strIntroduction: While many may not imagine camels when they think about Bali, our team has brought in 4 lovely Australian camels for a unique jaunt in south Bali. The 4 include one brother and one sister (Maddy and Albert) who are incredibly gentle and love to make friends! With more than 7500 guests having joined our animal tours, you can be sure that our guides are professional and always prioritise your safety and the animals' wellbeing. Our camels are equipped with a comfortable seat and handrail so that you can hold on throughout the ride. We provide helmets and stroll alongside the camels throughout your session to make sure you are comfortable and having fun! This ride is suitable for all ages (for children 5 and up) and each camel can carry 2 persons at a time, so you can bring your family and friends to meet these lovely creatures. START TIMES (DAILY): 8AM – 3 PM (Last ride starts at 3pm) We offer 2 options for the Camel Rides: OPTION A: 20 minute ride (great for those just looking to meet the camels) OPTION B: 1 Hour ride (You will pass some local homes and visit the turtle conservation centre for 15 minutes where you can learn about how we are trying to protect this amazing sea creature. This hour-long journey also includes photo-taking with the turtles) **See Notes for Weight Restriction
strTitle: Enjoy a Camel Ride in Bali

strIntroduction: Join us in our compound for a Target Practice, using professional Air guns. Do you think you are a good shooter? Or maybe you never shot a gun before? Let's find out! Our Shooting Range offers a variety of objects, at various distance. Our professional instructor will teach you how to shoot the target with Quality Competition Air gun (non real gun), as well as all the safety rules, before you begin. He will also assist you during the whole process. Then you will have a time to try! You can switch between different weapons and choose your conditions. All of our equipment is professional and checked daily. Our instructors are trained and will ensure you are in safe environment. During your activity we provide full insurance. This is your only chance to go to a Shooting Range in Bali. Don't miss it! You can come alone, or with friends and compete, who gets more points.
strTitle: Hone your Aiming at a Shooting Range

strIntroduction: - The arrival -- In our traditional Pondok. We will welcome you with freshly brewed organic coffee or mint/lemon grass tea with honey and a traditional snack. - Visit a traditional Balinese compound -- See how villagers still cook in bamboo huts on wood fires, how they love their roosters, see how they make their baskets, learn how they take their daily bath in the river in a village without running water. How they struggle in this mountain area and how we try to help them with our Farm Foundation. - The hike -- Start with picking your own lunch at The Farm. When our Team is preparing your lunch, you will follow the small farmer tracks to the stunning terraced rice-fields. Depending on the season of rice farming you give the rice farmers a helping hand (if you like) with harvesting or planting and experience yourself that this is hard work! - After all this work out you can have a bath in the natural hot springs in the river. Please note: No changing rooms in the jungle! (bring a sarong) - You continue walking through the typical Balinese village and will visit the local school if possible and still traditional beautiful bamboo temple. - The Lunch -- Freshly home-made using the ingredients you picked yourself this morning, as well as our delicious dark brown bread, homemade jams and ice cream, local snacks and juices. All fresh from the garden. - Your seeds of love -- Depending on what you prefer you will paint and decorate a rubbish bin on the road to help a small part of Bali to solve its rubbish problem or you will plant a fruit tree along the road so the next generation can “pick your fruits”.
strTitle: Spend a Day at a Secluded Organic Farm in a Balinese Village

strIntroduction: Away from the hustle and bustle in Tabanan regency (West Bali), there is a village named Jatiluwih, whose name can be traced to the words Jati and Luwih, meaning "real beauty". The Tabanan people in the area are mostly rice farmers, especially in Jatiluwih village, which is known to have a very extensive expanse of rice fields and stakes its claim as the rice storage center of Bali. Jatiluwih is currently the largest rice field in Bali that has been certified by UNESCO as organic. It is also famous for its water irrigation systems, which we will talk about on this trip. In this calm green space, you will get to enjoy air unpolluted by factories and exhaust fumes from motor vehicles. Along the way to Jatiluwih, we will pass through several local villages and witness the locals as they practice their daily customs. Walking across the Jatiluwih rice fields will take about 3 hours, with stops along the way to learn to identify wild herb plants. We will also cross the river where you can dip your legs into the fresh water. Bring your camera to enjoy the scenery and take a photo as a souvenir. I will point out the plants used in Bali traditional medicines and allow you to learn to identify them by sight, smell and taste. At our rest stop, I will also invite you to taste the red rice tea (supposed to improve your stamina) while you enjoy unforgettable views of the country side.
strTitle: Marvel at the most Stunning Rice Fields in Bali

strIntroduction: For all you bike enthusiasts out there, enjoy the thrill of riding through incredibly beautiful terrain with our newest Dirt Bike Tour! Our fleet of Kawasaki KLX250CC’s will ensure your tour is safe, fun and memorable. Our experienced team of instructors will guide you to cover a variety of terrains, varying from the black sand beaches at Yeh Gangga, to rivers and creeks, emerald-green rice fields and local Balinese Village areas. If you plan on coming with your friends, we're happy to cater for larger groups and can organise anything to make your trip a memorable one! The Dirt Bike Tour is only suitable for intermediate to advanced motor bike riders.
strTitle: Explore Bali on an Exhilarating Dirt-bike Tour

strIntroduction: Spend a magical evening out with your loved one at this intimate dinner for two in an all-bamboo house. Our bamboo homes are part of a luxurious privately-owned property tucked away in a super-secret address 30 minutes from Ubud, guaranteeing you absolute privacy during your evening meal. Surrounded by lush foliage with the raging Ayung river just beyond the trees, the houses are breathtaking in their detail and design, making them a truly unique location for a romantic evening out. Every piece of furniture in our house is made of bamboo and to create the perfect setting for a romantic soirée, we will decorate your table with a beautiful flower arrangement and candles. Below is our dinner menu MENU: Welcome drink of tamarind tea *** Vietnamese roll with prawn and mango dipping sauce *** Your choice of one main course: - Rib-eye steak with sautéed amaranth and mushrooms OR - Chargrilled young papaya steak with tasty Balinese sauce and sautéed amaranth and mushrooms OR - Chargrilled tuna steak with tasty Balinese sauce and sautéed amaranth and mushrooms *** Chocolate mousse with homemade lady fingers *** Complimentary water will be served throughout the dinner but you can add on a bottle of wine. This dinner is available every night but due to the limited availability of our homes, please give us at least 2 days notice so we can create an unforgettable evening for you! Dinner time: 5-8pm (latest 9pm for non-staying guests)
strTitle: Enjoy a Romantic Candlelight Dinner in an All-Bamboo House

strIntroduction: This is a unique and unforgettable experience to see this critically endangered Sumatran Orangutan (Pongo abelii) in the wild. You will see orangutans in their natural habitat, feeding, making nests, playing with their young or traversing the tree tops. Its also an opportunity to learn more about the orangutan and understand why they are so close to extinction.You will also learn about the local fauna & flora including traditional medicines used by the Sumatran people from your experienced guide. You will be trekking with just your guide, so you decide the pace and stop where you like. If you would like to join others trekking this is also possible – just let us know. Here's what you can expect to see on your Orangutan trek: - Ex-captive orangutans now living in the wild, making daily nests and feeding - Wild Orangutans - White handed Gibbons - Long and short tailed Macaques - Thomas leaf monkey - Hornbills- Asian Pied, Rhinoceros Hornbill - Monitor lizards, Flying Lizard - Green tree frogs - Signs of honey bears - Leopard cat - Amazing plant diversity plus many different tropical insects and birdlife How this trek benefits Sumatran Orangutans, Elephants and the National Park - Supporting local trekking guides, who also act as government forest rangers, living on simple wages - You will come away knowing more about the plight of the orangutan, and maybe even get inspired to help,or at least pass on your new knowledge to others. - Supporting local businesses at Bukit Lawang and Tangkahan which helps the local people place value on their natural resources and safeguards the future of the orangutan === Details of the Experience === Day 1 - Arrive Medan Sumatra - Airport transfer 3 hours from Medan Sumatra to Bukit Lawang - Sleep Bukit Lawang Day 2 - REST DAY / Explore the area (Note: this day can also be changed to day 5) - Orangutan feeding platform - Activities - Dinner - Sleep Bukit Lawang Day 3 - Guided trekking in Leuser National Park (4 – 5 hrs) - Dinner - Riverside camping Day 4 - Guided trekking in Leuser National Park - Dinner - Riverside camping Day 5. - Guided Trekking - Return river tube riding - Swimming - Dinner - Sleep Bukit Lawang Day 6. - Transfer to Medan Airport
strTitle: See Endangered Orangutans in the Wild

strIntroduction: This is a unique and unforgettable experience to see this critically endangered Sumatran Orangutan (Pongo abelii) in the wild. You will see orangutans in their natural habitat, feeding, making nests, playing with their young or traversing the tree tops. Its also an opportunity to learn more about the orangutan and understand why they are so close to extinction.You will also learn about the local fauna & flora including traditional medicines used by the Sumatran people from your experienced guide. You will be trekking with just your guide, so you decide the pace and stop where you like. If you would like to join others trekking this is also possible – just let us know. Here's what you can expect to see on your Orangutan trek: - Ex-captive orangutans now living in the wild, making daily nests and feeding - Wild Orangutans - White handed Gibbons - Long and short tailed Macaques - Thomas leaf monkey - Hornbills- Asian Pied, Rhinoceros Hornbill - Monitor lizards, Flying Lizard - Green tree frogs - Signs of honey bears - Leopard cat - Amazing plant diversity plus many different tropical insects and birdlife The best part of the trek is that it benefits the Sumatran Orangutans, Elephants and the National Park. By taking this trek you are: - Supporting local trekking guides, who also act as government forest rangers, living on simple wages - You will come away knowing more about the plight of the orangutan, and maybe even get inspired to help,or at least pass on your new knowledge to others. - Supporting local businesses at Bukit Lawang and Tangkahan which helps the local people place value on their natural resources and safeguards the future of the orangutan === Details of the Experience === Day 1 - Arrive Medan Sumatra - Airport Transfer 3 hours from Medan Sumatra to Bukit Lawang - Sleep Bukit Lawang Day 2 - Orangutan feeding platform - Guided trekking in Leuser National Park - Dinner - Riverside camping Day 3 - Guided trekking in Leuser National Park (4 – 5 hrs) - Return river rafting - Sleep Bukit Lawang Day 4 - ½ day motorbike ride to Tangkahan - River swimming / hot spring - Sleep Tangkahan Day 5 - Elephant trek & rehabilitation center - Elephant feeding and washing in the river - River tubing / Swimming - Sleep Tangkahan Day 6 - Transfer 7am to Medan Airport
strTitle: Orangutan & Elephant Trek with Camping

strIntroduction: Bedugul is the name of place located in mountain area encircled by the natural environment with beautiful panorama of Beratan Lake. Your full-day tour will last 8 hours and depart from your hotel. In this exciting stand-up paddle adventure you will paddle around the lake with our professional SUP guides. The water is clear and calm with beautiful mountains as backdrop view that will make you want to stay here! Everyone can stand up and paddle, and we will teach you the basics so that you can do so yourself within 5 minutes as well. What You Will Learn : Safety Getting familiar with equipment How to stand up on board and paddle Proper paddling stroke How to use paddle for balance How to turn the board How to pick up and carry board
strTitle: Enjoy Stand-Up Paddling on a Lake in Bali

strIntroduction: We will teach you the basics of standing and paddling on flat water. Everyone can stand up and paddle within 5 minutes of getting in the water. We will take you to a location in Southern Bali where conditions are ideal for beginner paddler. Come out and try the exciting new sport of stand up paddle! What You Will Learn : Safety Getting familiar with equipment How to stand up on board and paddle Proper paddling stroke How to use paddle for balance How to turn the board How to pick up and carry board
strTitle: Learn Stand-Up Paddle

strIntroduction: (This experience is hosted by a non-profit organization. It will receive 100% of the price listed here) This orphanage was set up In loving memory of Jodie O'Shea, a young Australian woman who tragically died as a result of the horrific Bali bombing on October 12, 2002. With the blessing of her parents, her memory lives on in our beautiful children and reminds us all that, even out of tragedy, truly wonderful acts of kindness are born and humanity can blossom and bringing joy and love. Our home currently houses 69 children, all orphans. We are a small team of people committed to providing a healthy, loving and secure environment for our family. There is no funding so we solely rely on the kind donations of others which include money, food and other essentials. As I'm sure you will agree, education is the key to a better future. All of our children attend local schools and our goal is to continue to support their educational efforts until they are able to go out into the workforce as confident adults. We will be grateful for any donation you can support us with! Volunteers are always welcome. **The price options available are the donation amounts that you can choose to make for your visit to the orphanage, regardless of your group size.
strTitle: Visit the Lovely Children from Jodie O'Shea Orphanage

strIntroduction: My mission with this class is to provide you with the knowledge, skills, inspiration and motivation required to embark on a healthy, vibrant, raw food-powered lifestyle. One of my favorite ways to do this is to teach people Raw Food Nutrition and Raw Food Freeshing in an intimate setting (my home) where you can see hands on just how easy it can be to make delicious, healthy food that supports your ideal lifestyle and life mission. The class will consist of us covering 6 raw food recipes, some of which are going to be hands on for you. At the end of the class, you will be able to take home a book of recipes so you can replicate these delicious dishes at home!
strTitle: Discover Raw Food in an Intimate Setting

strIntroduction: The cooking lessons are given by the beneficiaries of the Foundation (which themselves did not know Cooking 6 months ago). You cook what you eat and with a little luck, you'll even cook for customers of the "Fair Warung Balé". From 10:00 am to 12:00 am you will learn the ingredients that you will use in your meal (local spices, roots, meats, sauces, fruits, vegetables etc ...). You also can also go to the market with one of the beneficiaries of the Foundation. From 12:00, one after an other, you will cook your food in front of the other participants. You can chose to pay what you want for this experience - it's a donation to the foundation! Please select the amount in the options of the activity.
strTitle: Learn Balinese Cooking in a Social Warung

strIntroduction: Go back to nature! Come along a fascinating downhill cycling tour from Mount Batur (Kintamani Village) and through the quiet back roads of Bali's beautiful countryside. There is so much to explore. You will visit a woodcarving workshop, temples, a coffee plantation and many rice paddies fields. Experience local fruits, vegetables and herbal teas. Come and enjoy the mythical Balinese culture and hospitality with us!!!
strTitle: Cycle down a volcano and through the rice fields of Bali

strIntroduction: Let's get the new year started right! Join us to see Bali from a whole new angle and take in an aerial tour giving you an eagle-eye view of this breathtaking island! Your flight will start with you soaring over Bali's south-western coastline that includes legendary beaches such as Kuta and Legian. From there, we'll fly up to the iconic Tanah Lot temple, said to be guarded against intruders by mythical sea snakes. Next, we return inland over some gorgeous rice terraces and then proceed towards the southern Bukit peninsula. It's here that you'll glimpse and pass over the jaw-dropping Uluwatu Temple, situated on a 90-meter tall limestone cliff perched above the majestic Indian Ocean. Come try the aerial tours we've designed that show you the very best of Bali, the Island of the Gods - there's no better way to celebrate the special occasion and welcome 2016! Sights you'll see: - Kuta & Legian Beach - Tanah Lot Temple - Rice Terraces - Uluwatu Temple - Bukit (Peninsula) Coastline - Jimbaran Bay - Dreamland Beach - Seaweed Farms - Garuda Wisnu Kencana Statue Weight Limit - 442 KG
strTitle: 40 Min New Year's Day Helicopter Tour with Champagne Toast

strIntroduction: The traditional Javanese & Balinese way of celebrating is no less merry than exotic. This New Year's Eve, we'll be hosting an open-air celebration with a Pasar Malan atmosphere, the authentic, traditional Bali and Indonesia. Being present will mean traveling back through time up to hundreds of years, and finding yourself in a different era and place that of a forgotten Indonesia. One of the highlights of the night will be a REOG PONOROGO, a mamed hundreds-years-old annual festival hailed from Ponorogo in east Java involving a mythical battle between the King and the magical lion creature known as Singa Barong; this mystical creature is danced by men wearing masks weighing 30-40 kg supported only by the strength of their teeth! Besides that, you'll also enjoy a luxurious dinner spread as indicated in the menu below. As midnight approaches, the party will evolve with more festivities including a lively band's selection of tropical grooves and bonfires on the beach lawn facing the Indian ocean. Nothing compares to our grand finale though. During the countdown and as the clock strikes midnight, each guest and our staff will release sky lanterns from our lawn to usher in the new year. Watch as the night sky turns orange dotted with these lanterns, each carrying your wishes into the new year. So what are you waiting for? Come and join us at Hotel Tugu to make this celebration to remember! DINNER MENU at PASAR MALAM TUGU Appetizer Parade by Ibu-Ibu and Mbok Desa Martabak (fried stuffed pastry) Bakwan Jagung (Corn Fritters) Warung Aneka Bakaran (BBQ Menu) Sate Lilit (fish skewer) Sate Ayam (chicken skewer) Sate Vegetables (vegetable skewer) Sate Udang Bumbu Garlic Pesto (spiced prawn skewer) Ikan Bakar Madu & Bawang Putih (honey marinated spiced grilled fish) Warung Nasi Campur Bali (Balinese Mix Rice) Nasi Jagung (corn rice) Nasi Putih (steamed white rice) Tum Biu Batu (young banana with Balinese spiced chicken wrapped in banana leaves) Jukut Meurab (steamed vegetables in spicy grated coconut) Bebek Betutu (slow roasted Balinese duck) Jukut Ares (banana stem soup with chicken) Kerupuk Babi + Kerupuk Udang (pork skin and shrimp crackers) Babi Guling (slow roasted Balinese suckling pig) Warung Nasi Campur Jawa (Javanese Mix Rice) Nasi Bang Samin (East-Javanese fried rice) Nasi Kuning (turmeric rice) Nasi Merah (red rice) Botok Tahu Tempe (steamed tofu and soybean cake in banana leaves) Gudeg Nangka (young jackfruit in coconut milk) Plecing Kangkung (waterspinach with sambal) Rendang Jawa (slow cooked marinated tender beef) Kerupuk Kampung + Peyek (assorted crackers) Dessert Parade Lupis, Cenil, Putu Pukis Serabi Pandan Gulung Pisang Bubur Ketan Hitam
strTitle: Tugu New Year's Eve: Night Market & 1001 Lanterns by the Sea

strIntroduction: Come celebrate the New Year in style at El Kabron. With our party deck perched 50m above the majestic Indian Ocean, we are the best place in Bali to bid adieu a fantastic 2015 and to welcome an even better 2016. From 7:30pm onwards, whirl out to live music from the prodigious Tony Blunt and Cleave Martinez, while you enjoy a glass of wine (on the house; additional cocktails can also be purchased from the bar all night long) and our gourmet Spanish six-course dinner. We promise that it will be an experience to remember for a lifetime as you usher in the New Year over the Indian Ocean with a mesmerizing display of fireworks. NEW YEAR'S EVE DINNER Tapas and Appetizers Foie Gras Salty “Parfait” Fine Cantabrian anchovies on a sourdough toast Spanish selected Iberico Jam Truffled Cheese bites Toasted bread drizzled with tomato and extra virgin olive oil Starter Marlin “Onsen Tomago” Slow-cooked Marlin fillet, fennel hummus and lemon dressing Main “Canelón” Roasted chicken and beef “Canelloni” with wild mushrooms Paella Soft cooked Seafood Paella Dessert Pastry selected sweets and petit fours One Glass Complimentary Wine by Cape Discovery (our bar is open all night to order other cocktails)
strTitle: El Kabron New Year's Eve Gala Dinner in Uluwatu

strIntroduction: Come and celebrate the end of the year and open 2016 with us at Finn's Beach Club. We have an amazing night of fun, music, chill-out sessions, and good music planned. From 8pm onwards, jam out to live music from the fabulous Athron McCann while enjoying a welcome cocktail and gourmet food from the menu below (additional cocktails can also be purchased from the bar all night long). Then, starting at 11pm, chill out to DJ Buche on the beach with bonfires and our curated chill out lounges. At midnight, welcome 2016 with a sparkling toast while being dazzled by fireworks. Come join us at Finn's for New Year's Eve; this is one event you won't want to miss this holiday season! GOURMET COCKTAIL FOOD MENU Canapés Tasmanian Salmon Tartare With Sturia Caviar Smoked Duck & Goat Cheese Rolled Served On Crouton Queen Scallop Ceviche With Exotic Fruits Green Asparagus Rolled With Parma Ham & Provolone Cheese Smoked Salmon With Dill Cream Cheese Sweet Garlic & Potato Croquette With Paprika & Bell Pepper Coulis King Prawn Skewer With Housemade Thousand Island Dressing Cold Bites Yellowfin Tuna Tataki With Crushed Fennel & Passion Fruits Emulsion Fish Taco Served On An Organic Corn Chip Blinis With Sweet Pepper, Caramelized Onion & Chorizo Mozzarella, Cherry Tomato, Artichoke And Olive Skewer Chicken Tortillas With Avocado Guacamole, Coriander & Sour Cream Hot Bites “Cappuccino Style” Butternut Squash Soup With Balsamic Reduction Grilled Beef & Capsicum Skewer With Tzatziki Sauce Babi Guling Spring Roll Braised Beef Rendang With Sweet Potato Puree Vol Au Vent Maison With Spinach, Ricotta & Parmesan Pork Money Bag With Sweet & Sour Sauce Crispy Prawn Tempura With Coconut Curry Mayonnaise Grilled Fish Skewers With Sesame Seed, Avocado & Orange Emulsion Sweet Bites Lemon Tartlets With Flambé Meringue Mini Balinese Vanilla Crème Brulée Valhrona 72 % Bitter Chocolate Cake With Hazelnut & Banana Tiramisu Exotic Fruit Skewers Midnight Pizza Snack Station 4 Cheeses, Grilled Chicken, King Prawn, Primavera, Turkish Delight
strTitle: Finn's Beach Club New Year's Eve Cocktail Party

strIntroduction: This is our most popular scenic flight covering the following locations: - Tanah Lot temple - Located on a massive rock off the coast, this is one of Bali's most important sea temples, said to be protected by a mythical sea snake. A view from the air gives you a once-in-a-lifetime memory of this postcard-perfect world heritage site - Sanur's sweeping coastline - a favorite local haunt to catch the sunrise - Tabanan Rice Terraces - This area is off the regular tourist trail and thus a much quieter expansive of greenery. Wave to the farmers from above! - Seminyak - the heart of Bali's hip restaurant and shopping scene [Total weight limit: 457KG including luggage] NOTE: - If you have less than 4 in your group, the start time for your shared flight charter will be dependant upon the other guests whom you we are combining you with. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the possibilities. - Please plan to arrive at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: 30 Minute Scenic Bali Helicopter Flight (Shared)

strIntroduction: Whether it's your first time in Bali or your 5th time visiting, let us open your eyes to the beauty of the island from above. After a day relaxing by the beach or pool, wind down with this sunset helicopter tour to take in some of Bali's most important and beautiful landmarks: - Tanah Lot temple - the temple on a rock that is one of the island's must-see spots - the famous Kuta Beach - magnet to the surfer community in the 70s - Jimbaran bay - home to many a seafood restaurant, this crescent bay is lovely from above - Dreamland beach - recognised as one of the best surfing spots in Bali - Uluwatu temple and its spectacular cliffs - famous for the best sunset views in Bali - the seaweed farms of Bali's Southern Peninsula (yes you can actually see seaweed in the clear waters around Ceningan island!) [Total weight limit: 422kg including luggage] NOTE: - If you have less than 4 in your group, the start time for your shared flight charter will be dependant upon the other guests whom you we are combining you with. When going through the booking process, please note the start time you would prefer to fly at so we can then advise you on the possibilities. - Please be at the Heliport at least 30 minutes prior to your departure time to watch the instructional safety video
strTitle: 40 Minute Bali Sunset Helicopter Flight (Shared)

strIntroduction: For those who love marine life, the Gili islands offers fantastic snorkeling opportunities. You can rent masks and fins off pretty much any beach, but since the currents can be quite near the shore, book a trip with us so we can take you to the best locations directly (this saves you spending most of your energy fighting the currents before you reach the best snorkel spots) Our glass bottom boat will pick you up from Gili Trawangan around 10 AM to first get you set up with all the equipment and then take you to 3 of the best snorkel spots around the Gilis. Our visit will also include the shipwreck between Gili Meno and Gili Trawangan where we can see blue coral and a host of colorful marine life. If you don't mind getting to know other travelers while we take our big boat out, this trip is a great introduction to the Gili islands while getting a close up look at all the different kinds of colorful fishes and corals. You also get to see the 3 stunning islands and their beaches. Enjoy!
strTitle: Gili Islands Snorkel Trip by Glass Bottom Boat

strIntroduction: Let us know your arrival time in Lombok and we will send our spacious air-conditioned private car to pick you up from the airport and take you straight to Teluk Nara private boat harbor in Lombok where you will catch a private speedboat to the Gili Island of your choice (Gili Trawangan, Gili Meno or Gili Air). With this speedboat, the journey which usually takes 25minutes by public slow boat (not recommended for a smooth experience) only takes 5 minutes. This is the quickest, easiest and most convenient way to get to the Gili Islands and for maximum convenience, you can also book the reverse journey on your way back to Lombok.
strTitle: Private Transfer from Lombok Airport to the Gili Islands

strIntroduction: Tucked by the surf and sunset beach of Canggu is one address to visit for a most authentic old Bali experience – a little hidden gem called Hotel Tugu Bali, awarded as one of the most unique places in the world and frequently mentioned as ‘a sampling of paradise’. This New Year's Eve, our celebration is inspired by the life of the charismatic artist Walter Spies in Bali. The legendary Walter Spies arrived in Central Java in the early 1920s and then lived in Bali till the end of 1930s. Spies was one of the biggest art heroes in Bali, and gave a great contribution to the Balinese art. His life was forever surrounded by arts: paintings, music, cinema and dance. His house in Bali was an established stop on the circuit of well-known figures as Charlie Chaplin, anthropologist Margaret Mead, Mexican artist and caricaturist Miguel Covarrubias and many more passed through as guests. For this New Year Eve 1930’s party, find yourself transported to the romantic art deco era of Bali in the early 20th century and celebrate like the 1930s artists. Walter Spies' choreography of the celebrated Kecak dance that became the trademark of Bali will be performed as well as other old dances of Bali 1930s, followed by the 1920s and 1930s swing jazz tunes of Marlene Dietrich, Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington, Louis Armstrong The night will begin with a short Balinese blessing, followed by a 1930s celebration in style. Lavish 5 course dinner, welcome cocktail and dances till the countdown. MENU: Javanese Clam Soup Kaffir lime, tamarind, light coconut milk ~ ~ ~ Tugu’s Signature Pork Belly Kalas long beans, Balinese spiced sauce ~ ~ ~ Tamarillo & Mint Sorbet ~ ~ ~ Lamb Chops Rendang Style Couscous, mint, cucumber, baby red onions, kemangi leaves or Grilled Scallops Creamy black ink rice, baby squid, roasted vegetables, tingkih & bumbu seasoning or Eggplant & Tofu Kare Sweet tempe straws, sundried tomato rice ~ ~ ~ Indonesia’s Original Lapis Cake Tingting kacang crispy shavings, caramel & macadamia ice cream ~ ~ ~ Tea, Coffee & Petits Fours
strTitle: Celebrate New Year's Eve in Bali with a 1930s Themed Party

strIntroduction: On December 25th at 7 pm, embrace the spirit of Christmas at one of Bali's most beautiful boutique hotels with a concert of christmas carols sung by the children of the Panti Asuhan Alas Kasih Orphanage followed by the distribution of Christmas presents through donations to our Wishing Tree. Please join us and the children from Negara as we cherish the joyful moment of this Festive Season. We invite you to accompany us in the Christmas spirit and to contribute to the lives of these children by celebrating Christmas Day at Hotel Tugu Bali. Share the love with the less privileged and give back to our community the happiness they all deserve. Festive 5 Course Menu Including Tropical Cocktail & Christmas Carols MENU Beetroot & Apple Soup Crème fraîche, grissini ~ ~ ~ Exotic Christmas Salad Selection of fresh garden salad, watercress, walnut, feta, orange, passion fruit or Sesame Crusted Seared Tuna Rice noodles, sautéed vegetables, edamame, light sweet & sour dressing ~ ~ ~ Kaffir Lime & Basil Sorbet ~ ~ ~ Open Ravioli, Butternut Squash & Porcini Mushroom Spinach, parmesan shavings, nutmeg or Mango Glazed Mahi Mahi Orzo, green peas, asparagus, cashew nuts, coconut shrimps or Balinese Infused Duck with all the Trimmings Sautéed potatoes, carrots, Brussels sprouts, Yorkshire pudding ~ ~ ~ Tamarillo Cheesecake Roasted walnut, cinnamon, rosella infused dressing or Tugu’s Sticky Toffee Pudding Macadamia ice cream, caramel and our final secret touch ~ ~ ~ Tea, Coffee & Petits Fours Includes 1 Tropical Christmas Cocktail per person.
strTitle: Celebrate Christmas in Bali with a Charity Concert & Dinner

strIntroduction: Begin up in the mountain of the Bedugul region, overlooking the gorgeous rice paddies and experience an atmosphere that's quite different to the more commonly known and advertised south Bali. Start the hike by walking down into the jungle. The first few metres will be easy as we have a footpath laid out for you. You will reach an open space that has a few different temples. Our guide will sit you down and explain the significance of Balinese Village Temples. After this short rest, the trekking continues, slightly tougher than the start but still completely manageable. You will find yourself enclosed by the thick trees and plants. Our guides will point out all the natural vegetation and inform you more about the jungle's ecosystem. We will stop by one of the oldest trees in the Jungle (more than a couple hundreds old at least), and if you'd like, you can swing from one of the tree vines, just like Tarzan :) After that, we will continue down to see more local shrines and temples and enjoy a couple of local organic fruits like passionfruit and oranges whilst taking a short break. We will end the trek by crossing the Tamblingan Lake using a traditional dugout canoe ,steered and paddled by one of our local Balinese village men. Of course, if you'd like to try your hand at it and get a workout in, you're free to do so!
strTitle: Canoe and Trek through Bali's Jungle and Lake in Bedugul

strIntroduction: Walk an invigorating journey through the shaded gardens of our natural Eco-Park, where you will discover and sample a range of traditional Indonesian health/healing remedies, such as Jamu drinks, sourced from many tropical herbs grown in our organic gardens. On your journey, you will discover our Waste Recycling Station, where ROLE demonstrates how to separate and recycle Indonesia's waste and reduce pollution for a clean Bali. We will show you our Compost Station, where we can teach you how to produce your own organic compost for use in our gardens, chemical-free. Discover our organic permaculture planting techniques, reforestation in Indonesia, and explore alternative energy sources in our solar renewable energy establishment. You can experience the natural dyeing of cotton using Ketapang leaves, and explore the production in our Natural Dyeing and Weaving workshop, where local Indonesian women weave beautiful scarves using astounding traditional machines. The "Weaving Futures: Natural Dyes and Weaving" is an important station in our Eco-park, because you are given the opportunity to purchase our beautiful products, which support local women and ROLE's commitment to alleviate poverty and empower women through skills education. Explore our marine protection and protected species station, then at our "Soap for Hope" station, we show you how used soap is cleaned and recycled using 3 cleaning processes, heating then pressing, for later donation to orphanages in need. Lastly, have a refreshing finish at our park's Scenic Warung at the top of the mountain, where you can enjoy views over Nusa Dua and beyond, while we serve you fresh fruits and drinks.
strTitle: Enjoy a Nature Tour of our Sustainable Eco-Centre in Bali!

strIntroduction: Out on the seas, one yacht stands out among all others with its beautiful design and sleek aesthetic, our superyacht! If you're looking for something out of the ordinary, an amazing time out on the high seas, a mind-blowing location to celebrate a wedding, birthday, or company party, you've come to the right place for the ultimate party on the water! == The Boat / Journey == Once an Indonesian cargo ship, Italian architect designers have refurbished this 130 foot long ship it into a uniquely luxurious superyacht. We used local teak and iron wood panelling to give life to something different from the usual superyacht, yet still elegant. On top of that, we added a state-of-the-art cockpit and jacuzzi pool, swanky bar, restaurant and entertainment lounge, and six gorgeous air-conditioned cabins with all the modern amenities you ask for. Designed as a space where music, service and entertainment blend together to become its distinctive feature, our yacht is the perfect venue for you create your own club on the move. The entertainment lounge is fitted with a huge flat-screen TV and a Bose surround sound system that provides vibes throughout the superyacht and the entire vessel is equipped with subtle lighting that emanates from behind the rich wood panelling. Up top the party zone transforms in the evening into a venue that one would only find in the best clubs in Tokyo, New York, London, or Paris! The result is a beautiful superyacht that one could only dream of, something we call eco/luxury! Best of all, we can sail anywhere, so you can choose between a roundtrip journey to Nusa Lembongan, where you'll be able to snorkel, or one around Bali to view its majestic east coast and the towering Mt. Agung that rises above the entire land. == Special Italian Canapé Lunch Menu == This special lunch is served on board! Canapé Station with 400 Canapés, including: Tomato bruschetta Mushrooms garlic Pepper cream cheese Bresaola rocket Salad Station Selection of lettuce, tomatoes, corn, carrots, boiled potatoes, crispy bacon, boiled eggs, cucumbers, and more with a choice of either French, cocktail, or yoghurt dressing. Pasta Bar Traditional lasagna Tagliatelle pesto Tagliatelle bolognese Main Course Scallopine al limone (chicken breast in a lemon sauce) Polpete napolitana (Italian meatballs in tomato sauce) Roasted potato rosemary Dessert Ice coffee cream (coffee cream mousse) Served with a glass of wine or beer, soft drinks, mineral water, tea & coffee == Boat Technical Specifications == Length: 130ft (40m) Max Width: 25ft (10m) Engine: 380hp (385cv) Max Speed: 10 marine knots Autonomy: 600 miles (1110km) 87 hours Construction Material: Iron & Teak Wood Maximum Capacity: 125 Passengers Crew: 7 Onboard Facilities: Jacuzzi pool 6 master cabins with private toilet 2 guest toilets Open bar, kitchen and restaurant Cinema room
strTitle: Charter a Luxury Superyacht for a Private Party on the Water

strIntroduction: There's no need rough it out if you want to interact with wildlife. Travel in style in our luxury yacht whilst getting the opportunity to get up close with the Komodo dragons during one of our stops at the Komodo Island as well as test out a variety of dive sites. It's the perfect adventure! Itinerary: Day 1: Departure from Denpasar airport* (Bali) Day 2 : Labuan Bajo - Sabolan (2x day dives) Day 3 : Gili lawa laut - Gili lawa darat (3x day dives + 1 night dive) Day 4 : Sangeang – Banta Island (3x day dives + 1 night dive) Day 5 : Back to Labuan Bajo and special free dinner Dragoon130 Day 6 : Arrival in Denpasar airport (Bali) Once an Indonesian cargo ship, Italian architect designers have refurbished it into a gorgeous yacht by using its original teak and ironwood panelling and adding a state-of-the-art cockpit and jacuzzi pool on the upper deck, a swanky bar, restaurant and entertainment lounge on the lower deck, and six luxurious air-conditioned cabins with all the modern amenities you ask for. The idea behind this redesigning is to encourage not only the recycling of materials but to support the use of local materials. Technical Specifications: - Lenght: 130ft (40m) - Max Widht: 25ft (10m) - Engine: 380hp (385cv) - Max Speed: 10 marine knods - Autonomy: 600 miles (1110km) 87 hours - Construction Materials: iron & teak wood - Jacuzzi Pool - 6 Master Cabines with private toilette - 2 Guest Toilette - OpenBar and Kitchen - Cinema room - Total Passengers: 12 - Crew: 7
strTitle: Dragoon130 Luxury Yacht - Komodo Adventure 2015

strIntroduction: Once an Indonesian cargo ship, Italian architect designers have refurbished it into a gorgeous yacht by using its original teak and ironwood panelling and adding a state-of-the-art cockpit and jacuzzi pool on the upper deck, a swanky bar, restaurant and entertainment lounge on the lower deck, and six luxurious air-conditioned cabins with all the modern amenities you ask for.
