Wood Carving Lesson in Central Ubud

strIntroduction: If you are an underwater enthusiast, drive directly to north west Bali to snorkel in the crystal clear waters of Menjangan Island and explore its amazing reef. Located just 5 miles off the coast of north-west Bali, the island is famous for the herds of wild deer which swim to the island every spring, but it's what under the water that's pretty amazing too. On this special day out, I'll bring you to see massive sea walls, Nemo (clown fish) and even friendly sea turtles! I promise it will be a day you won't forget. OUR ITINERARY: 06.00: We start our drive along the west coast of Bali from your hotel 09.30: Arrive in West Bali at the port 10.00: Prepare our snorkling or diving equipment 10.30: Take a 40-minute boat to Menjangan island 11.15 - 16.00: 2 dives with a local dive master and lunch on the island 16.00: Return to the mainland 20.00: Arrive back in your hotel
strTitle: Dive or Snorkel around Menjangan Island in North West Bali

strIntroduction: For nature lovers and those interested in seeing a unique side of Bali not many tourists see, let me bring you deep into the island for a unique view. On this tour, we will enter the West Bali National Park, located on the north western side of Bali and enjoy a leisurely nature hike there with local fauna. We also make a few stops at cultural points of interest on the way back south, including a catholic cathedral and an important coastal temple. If you want to get off the beaten track, this would be it! ITINERARY (14 hours): 06.00: We start our drive along the west coast of Bali 08.00: Optional stop for breakfast at the village of Soka - with great views of the Indian Ocean from our restaurant location 08.30: Continue on our journey 10.00: Arrive in West Bali at the port of Labuan Lalang. 10.00 - 11.00: Begin our hike to see the blue and endangered white myna birds who live in the forest. During our walk, we may also bump into monitor lizards, snakes and perhaps antelope or deer! If we are REALLY lucky, we might be able to spot the servant eagle, one of the most spiritual birds in Bali and the inspiration for the Garuda! 11.00: Leave to return to South Bali 12.00: Arrive at the catholic community of Eka Sari village to see its beautiful big cathedral with unique Balinese decoration - the Dutch missionaries came to Bali and ordered it to be built in 1958. 13.00: Visit Pengambengan Fishermen village to see the unique boats from Arabic times. Hear the fascinating stories about this Muslim corner of Bali. 14.15: Arrive in Negara village to see its traditional market. Stop for lunch in a local restaurant. Try the local street food and rest for 1 hour. 16.00: Arrive in the coastal temple of Rambut Siwi temple, one of Bali's 8 directional temples revered by the Balinese. Learn about its fascinating history. Walk along the black sand beach, enjoy the amazing red sunset 18.00: Leave for your hotel 20.00: Arrive at your hotel
strTitle: West Bali National Park & Cultural Day Tour

strIntroduction: Learn stand up paddle board (SUP) in Bali with us, and you'll be piloting the board along the beautiful coastline! Forget grovelling around the water, with the SUP, you can power through waves of all sizes with a quick change of your foot or with a stroke of your paddle. There is nothing more beautiful than gliding over the water as fish and rays swim underneath you. Level 1: Learn about the SUP equipment and pick up some basic paddling skills. You'll master the essential techniques and practice paddling across flat water, making turns, and learning how to stay upright. Level 2: Find out how to ride small waves, switch feet and keep balance while you paddle onto waves and make smooth exits. You'll learn how to control the board with your paddle and by moving your weight. Level 3: Pick up some advanced skills and move up to larger waves. Learn how to use the power of the paddle to rotate on your fins, move into and float off sections, and power into breaking waves with ease. Level 1 lessons will be held in Jimbaran beach, while Level 2 & 3 will be held in Sanur beach. Transportation between the 2 beaches will be provided. All lessons will begin with a 15min warm up session and briefing on land, where you can practice your SUP techniques before launching in the water. If you prefer free & easy stand up paddling, you can also rent our SUP boards to explore the oceans on your own.
strTitle: Learn Stand-Up Paddle Board in Bali

strIntroduction: I can offer you spiritual insights into your future by reading your palm. The lines of your palm reveal much about a person's character, current situation, and future life. By evaluating the various lines, bumps, skin color, skin texture, and shape of your palm, I will tell you key insights into your future that you may be curious about.
strTitle: Attend Fortune Telling by a Bali Shaman Healer (Balian)

strIntroduction: Join on us our trip to explore the beautiful Moyo island and Satonda island. Spread over 6 nights, we will cruise along the empty Lombok and Sumbawa coastlines by day and sleep at "our very own" deserted beaches by night. Moyo and Satonda are very much off the beaten path and are only ever visited by the occasional live aboard passing through. We will spend our days visiting Satonda's crater lake, waterfalls, beaches and snorkeling or diving the crystal clear waters surrounding Moyo and Satonda Island. Satonda island is a small volcano with a salt water lake in its crater, a beautiful beach on the east side, and a large colony of fruit bats which take flight for its nightly hunt at dusk. Satonda is also home to both great day and night dive locations. Moyo island offers something for everyone. There are two waterfalls that you can only reach by walking through a small traditional village and along a beautiful path into the island. Moyo island is also home to two reserves. One is the Moyo Hunting Reserve, home to barking deer, wild pig and macaques. Second is the Marine Park off Moyo that insures some great reef diving. South Moyo is also home to a small Japanese wreck which is great for both a day and night diving. You can also opt for an additional day time scuba diving package, and a UV night dive. Highlights including Blue Tree Wall, Lighthouse, Little Angel, Big Angel and the small WW2Japanese wreck. If you aren't comfortable with diving, we also offer a UV Snorkel add-on.
strTitle: Explore Moyo Island and Satonda Island

strIntroduction: Increase your knowledge of the under water world with some in depth training on fish, substrates and invertebrates. Learn how to teach the EcoDiver course and help to spread the good work of Reef Check. This course is very popular with Dive Instructors. You will be certified to teach the Eco Diver course and the Discover Reef Check course. Prerequisites: Is a certified Reef Check EcoDiver, aged 18 years or above, and has completed any one of the following: a. has completed a minimum of 8 Reef Check surveys, or, b. has completed 4 or more academic or regionally recognized surveys (e.g. AGRRA) plus 6 Reef Check surveys, or, c. has a Master's degree in marine biology and has completed a minimum of 6 Reef Check surveys.
strTitle: Reef Check Instructor Course

strIntroduction: Sumbawa is one of Indonesia's untouched gems. For 10 nights, we will cruise Sumbawa's beautiful and rugged coastline down the Alas strait, snorkel or dive beautiful reefs & a small WW2 wreck, visit the famous Princess Di waterfalls & Satonda island, its lake & fruit bat colony After exploring the Alas strait we will venture east to Moyo and Satonda islands. Moyo is home to the famous Priness Diana waterfalls where you can enjoy a refreshing fresh water swim and fly over the waterfall on a rope swing. Half of Moyo island is a nature reserve and protected in the south is a beautiful white sand beach that we named fossil beach after discovering giant fossilised corals and clams on the beach. Off Moyos west coast is the highlight of Moyos underwater world; beautiful Angel Reef suitable for divers and snorkelers alike. To the north east of Moyo is a small volcano called Satonda, this volcano was hit by a tsunami many years ago and has a wam salt water lake in its small crater. In the southern bay where we will be moored are two beautiful dive and snorkel sites, with plenty more to be found all the way around the small volcano. In the evening a fruit bat colony that lives in Satondas caves flies off on their nightly hunt at dusk, a truely beautiful sight! In the evenings we will enjoy meals on board and beach BBQs and bonfires before retiring to your cabin or pulling your mattress our on deck and sleeping under the stars to the sound of water lapping the side of the hull.
strTitle: 10% OFF Island Hopping, Snorkeling, & Diving in Sumbawa

strIntroduction: Enjoy your own private boat for a day of cruising the crystal clear waters surrounding the 3 Gili islands - Gili Trawangan, Gili Meno and Gili Air. You will ride in a traditional Bangka style Balinese boat with plenty of shade and netting in the outriggers for you to relax in and above the water. Time is free and flexible, and entirely up to you. Whether you choose to explore all 3 of the islands and snorkel the best reefs that the Gilis has to offer, or simply choose to sunbathe on the boat. The captain and crew will be there to help with your perfect island getaway.
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Day Charter Around Gili Islands

strIntroduction: Reef Check is an international organization dedicated to coral conservation. It was established in 1996 in an attempt to create a simple standardised marine survey that can be used to monitor corals worldwide. Take part in our 5 night Reef Check Expedition to the North West corner of Sumbawa, where we will be conducting reef check surveys to contribute towards the establishment of a new marine park in the area. We also plan to start a new monitoring program of the manta rays and dugongs in the area with the data being used by manta watch to help tract the movements of these great marine mammals. Volunteers must be qualified Reef Check Eco Divers. Meeting point is at Manta Dive at 3pm on the day of departure. Please check in at Manta Dive 24 hours before departure to complete paperwork. ITINERARY: Day 1- Depart from Gili Trawangan at 3pm for an overnight crossing to Sumbawa. Day 2 - Conduct survey 1 & 2. Optional UV night dive. Day 3 - Conduct exploration dive to find new survey site and conduct survey 3. Conduct survey 4. Optional UV night dive Day 4 - Explore mangroves and look for juvenile species living within them. Conduct survey 5. Optional UV night dive Day 5 - Conduct exploration dive to find new survey site and conduct survey 6. Depasrt Sumbawa for overnight crossing to Gili Trawangan.
strTitle: Monitor Corals in a 6D5N Reef Check Expedition

strIntroduction: Flyboarding is a fast, fun and exciting new water sport that is literally taking off! We are excited to bring you this new revolutionary water craft and get you swimming like a dolphin and and soaring and spinning through the air. Aquaflight is the perfect example of when a picture speaks a thousand words! The price includes 10 minutes land training and 20 minutes fly time with a certified instructor. Come try this amazing new sport we've brought to Gili Trawangan and we know you'll get hooked! Note: we are located in Gili Trawangan (Gili T) and that location is the departure point for this experience
strTitle: Fly through the Air with Aqua flight Flyboard!

strIntroduction: Create your very own unique piece of jewelry - a bracelet, necklace, anklet, or whatever you desire - all under the watchful eye of your friendly workshop teachers. In our cheerful store, we have jars, boxes, and dishes of beads, bells, baubles, and tassels galore ,available in all colors of the rainbow and more, so you can pick your fancy, play around, and express your creativity! Depending on what you'd like to make, we can teach you how to make special knots to secure your accessories and give you a second opinion if you need one! This is a great activity for all ages, so bring your friends and family along for some fun with us!
strTitle: Join a Jewelry Making Workshop in Seminyak

strIntroduction: Join us for a completely new diving or snorkelling experience, unique to the Gili Islands. UV night diving and snorkelling shows the underwater world in colours you would only expect to see at a full moon party. Fluorescence underwater occurs when we shine blue, near UV lights on corals and fish that contain proteins that absorbs the blue light and re-emit the light in a different wavelength (colour). The result is incredible, on a UV night dive you can expect to see fluo pink scorpion fish, yellow shrimps and moray eels, orange crabs, green, pink and yellow corals. UV diving is still new and very little is know as to why corals and marine life glow with flouresence under water, Dr Charles H. Mazel PhD, an expert in flourence believes that fluorescing corals may indicate the health of a reef, in which case it could become a very important part of future reef conservation. UV night diving can be arranged every night of the week, spaces are limited so be sure to book in advance! For those who do not have logged night dives but still want to explore and get a taste of what the UV night diving world is like, UV Night Snorkel is the perfect activity for you. We depart from Gili Trawangan and visit 1 snorkel spot for a 30 minute snorkel and return to Gili Trawangan. PLEASE NOTE: ADVANCE BOOKING FOR UV NIGHT SNORKELLING IS NOT POSSIBLE. Very few sites around the Gilis are suitable for uv night snorkelling and the conditions have to be good for these sites to be available (ie no currents), it will be decided on the day if it will be available that night. So do MESSAGE OUR HOSTS and they will get in contact with you prior to and when you are on Gili Island, to inform you if you can do the UV night snorkel activity Photo credits: uwphotographyguide.com scubaboard.com www.dive.in Hermit - oceanfilms.co
strTitle: Try a Spectacular UV Night Dive/Snorkel on the Gili Islands

strIntroduction: Did you ever dream of becoming a marine biologist or do you just love snorkeling? The Reef Check EcoDiver program allows anyone with an interest in the ocean -- from kids to adults – to learn more about tropical coral reefs. Reef Check combines education with action to give volunteers a unique experience while taking an active role in conserving the world’s reefs. The EcoDiver program allows participants the rare opportunity to work with teams of scientists throughout the world to combat the crises affecting our reefs today. The world’s reefs are changing fast, and it is up to us to ensure that reefs are around for future generations. How can you help? Simple. If you have experience snorkeling and diving, you can enroll in this 3-day EcoDiver certification course that qualifies you to help our teams to monitor reefs worldwide. Using the globally standardized scientific protocol, the Reef Check EcoDiver program collects valuable data to establish the status of coral reefs world wide. The data are analyzed and used locally by marine park managers, nationally by fisheries and environment managers and internationally by organizations including United Nations agencies to help better track and care for coral reefs. During this trip, you will learn about the threats to our local reefs and why monitoring the reefs are so important, marine identification and EcoDiver survey methods which will give you the skills which will allow you to take part in and conduct your own Reef Check surveys around the world. Prerequisites for the EcoDiver Course: - Open Water (any agency) - Complete a Peak Performance Buoyancy course EcoDiver Course includes training on substrates, invertebrates and fish identification, line deployment, site marking, data entry and full surveys. Please ask us if you have any questions!
strTitle: Learn to Save the Reefs on a 4 Day Eco Diver Course

strIntroduction: Ever wanted to learn more about Indonesian cuisine? This cooking class in our home is a great way to learn more about this delicious cuisine in a friendly and welcoming environment. We start the day by picking you up from your hotel in Senggigi at around 9.45am. Then, it is a short 10-15 minute drive to our house, where you can enjoy our welcome drink and relax in the garden. The day will start with me introducing the utensils, ingredients and background of Indonesian cuisine. I will then assign each person a task, such that we can get cooking! : ) The cooking will take about 2 hours, and starting 12pm, we can sit down to enjoy the food and chat until 1.30pm. We make a minimum of 4-5 dishes each class, and a sample menu might look like below (this changes every day depending on what I think will go together): - Tempe manis - Fish in Banana Leaf - Perkedel Jagung (Corn Fritters) - Curry (Chicken, Fish or Beef) - Tofu with Yoghurt and Cream - Ikan bakar (Grilled fish) As someone who understands what it is like living abroad, I make it a point to teach dishes that you can reproduce at home, with the ingredients easily available to you. If you have any food allergies, just let us know and we can plan accordingly. Come and visit us the next time you are in Lombok and I look forward to welcoming you to our home.
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Home Cooking Class in Lombok

strIntroduction: It is said that Canggu Beach has one of the most beautiful sunsets in the island. If horse riding sounds like too much of a hassle and you'd like to avoid the crowds at Tanah Lot or Uluwatu, opt for a romantic soirée with your sweetie and hop aboard the Bendi - a vintage horse drawn carriage. As you snuggle together, we take you on a sunset ride on the beach and into the breezy rice paddies of the tranquil fishing villages nearby Hotel Tugu in quiet Canggu. The picturesque scenery we encounter sets the mood for a romantic night out and the rustic charm of this horse drawn carriage will make your evening with us one to remember.
strTitle: Enjoy a Romantic Sunset Horse-Drawn Bendi Ride

strIntroduction: While you might come to Bali to see the sights, one of the most memorable and unique experiences you can have is a one night stay with the locals to experience our rhythm of life. As I have always been excited to showcase my village to guests, I've created an overnight program as follows to give you a taste of what it is like to live in an authentic Balinese community: DAY 1: 7pm: Pick up from your hotel for a night in our traditional Balinese house in Bona Village, which is famous for Lontar, or manuscripts made from dried palm leaves. Some even say the famous Kecak dance originated here! DAY 2: The next morning: Have some breakfast in our house, then follow my family to our traditional market for vegetables and meat. You will get a chance to see how we shop for our home-cooked lunch. After the market visit: Learn how to make local Balinese offerings called Canang Sari that we will place in the temple of the house (we do this multiple times a day). After you are done making offerings, we will take you to the rice fields with the men of the village to see how they work (you can also learn to plant rice!) before lunch time. Lunch: a home-cooked Balinese meal. Afternoon: We'll bring you to take a traditional Balinese Dance lesson at one of the dance studios in our village. In preparing for dinner, help us make the ubiquitous Balinese dish called Lawar - made from a mixture of vegetables, coconut and minced meat mixed with rich herbs and spices. It is so delicious that you will surely ask for the recipe! To complete your stay with us, enjoy dinner with us and soak in the camaraderie around the table. 8pm: Leave for your hotel. NOTE: If you are interested to see our village in a day (without the overnight stay), we can still fit all our activities in one day (Day 2's schedule). Just select the correct price on the drop down box to book this.
strTitle: Authentic Bali: Overnight Stay in a Traditional Village

strIntroduction: For hundreds of years, life in the Palace of Forbidden City of Beijing was dominated by the large number of eunuchs– men castrated to qualify as the emperor’s servants. In 1644 the Manchus conquered the Ming Dynasty and built the last dynasty to rule China, under the name “Qing”. The emperors during the Qing dynasty were very proud of the parties they held, especially the parties that took place in the Hall of Supreme Harmony, the room that was used to enthrone Emperor Pu Yi in 1908. At the end of the Ming Dynasty there were about 70,000 eunuchs employed by the emperor, some serving inside the Imperial Palace. Certain eunuchs gained immense power that occasionally superseded that of prime ministers. The dinner parties in this Hall of the Supreme Harmony were famous for their excellent service and their entertainment. The privilege of welcoming of the Emperor’s guests had the most experienced senior eunuchs. These days, this unique, colorful and merry way of dining is brought back to life by the Tugu Bali. It was inspired by the imperial way of dining in the Hall of Supreme Harmony at the Forbidden City. In Tugu Bali it is done at the 305-year-old Kang Xi period temple of Bale Sutra, specially reconstructed on the property. Presenting fine wines and delicious dishes of choice on antique silver trays, the dinner features a procession of eunuchs in colorful clothes and masks, playing merry instruments and singing poetic songs. It is a unique dining experience you will never forget. MENU Guo Tieh Tugu fried wonton dumplings with pork, chinese mushrooms, ginger and garlic filling *** Sweet Corn Soup with crab meat and onion greens *** Stir Fried Eggplants and Tofu with garlic and sweet spicy bean paste *** Breaded Deep Fried Baby Lobster with baby kalian and creamy lime coriander sauce *** Steamed Garupa marinated in rice wine, ginger, carrot and onions with soy sesame sauce *** Fragrant Tender Duck five spice marinated steamed and fried duck with mandarin pancakes *** Yangzhou Fried Rice with shrimps, ginger, peas, eggs, rice wine soy sauce and coriander *** Deep Fried Vanilla Ice Cream with coconut
strTitle: Enjoy a Royal Feast in a 300-year-old Chinese Temple

strIntroduction: If you're looking to spend your day experiencing the best of horseback riding and zooming along on your ATVs, come join my team for an exhilarating day out! Whatever your age or experience level might be, we have horses to match all experience levels, from Beginners to Advanced, and we cater for everyone ranging from individuals to groups. Our schedule is as follows: - 2 hours Horse-back Riding: Village riding, passing rice fields, beach riding, creek crossings, river crossing, stopping at a bat cave for exceptional cliff top views and passing beach temples - Lunch at a local restaurant in Tabanan Regency so that you get to experience eating in a local (but clean) warung (or eatery) - We pay a visit to the Monkey Forest in Tabanan, which is calmer than the Monkey Forest in Ubud. A guide will show you around the area so you get some good photos with the cheeky animals. - 2 hours on the ATV: we will bring you to navigate through the ricefields of Yeh Gangga (a seaside village just west of Tanah Lot) and meander through adjoining villages, with a stop on the top of the seaside cliffs overlooking the spectacular coastline and seaside temple. Experience the fun and exhilaration of cruising along the black sand beach, crossing fresh water streams, viewing the rural panorama and surf-side Yeh Gangga. Unlike other operators which might use lower-quality equipment, we provide high quality Honda and Yamaha Grizzly 700CC ATVs to ensure that your tour is safe, comfortable and fun. - We make a stop at Tanah Lot so you can enjoy an incredible sunset to top off a your memorable day with us!
strTitle: Enjoy a Full Day of Fun on Horseback and ATV

strIntroduction: Fantastic fun set in our authentic Jungle Village. Play among derelict houses with bush, bunkers and fire trenches, dodging bullets and avoiding incoming fire. Pit your wits against your friends and our teams. It's a game of great skill and strategy. Our usual game is a Conquest game - your group will be divided into two even teams. One team will be defending the fort, while others are attacking. Our battleground has tons of interesting features, allowing you to do interesting tactical moves, as well as bold solo actions! Each round is 20 minutes long, after which you will have time to rest and talk about the most amazing moves! Then you will return to the battlefield and teams will switch. We use only the latest U.S. equipment and supplies, guaranteeing great fun in a safe environment!
strTitle: Paintball Games - Conquest and Defend

strIntroduction: Not many Westerners know about Bahasa, but it's actually a language spoken by more than 200 000 000 people! Can you imagine that? And it's also very easy. So how about trying it, when you are in Bali? I'm very interested in culture exchange, so I love meeting with foreigners. I like to teach them Balinese customs. I was teaching my friends Bahasa for some time, but I would like to teach you too! Balinese people will be very surprised and happy, if you can speak some basics to them. I will be happy to meet you and be your teacher. So let's study together, and have fun!
strTitle: Learn Basic Bahasa with a Local in Bali

strIntroduction: Learn the basics of Freediving through the theory and confined water dives of the Level 1 course. See your snorkelling ability soar as you experience the benefits of knowledge and skills of a SSI Freediver, and be eligible for SSI Snorkeller Certification, finding dives to 4 metres easily achievable and more comfortable than you could have imagine! The course runs from 0700 til approx 1800 and includes: 2 theory sessions (4hrs) 1 yoga session (2hrs) 1 confined water session (2hrs)
strTitle: Introduction to Freediving: Fusion Snorkeller

strIntroduction: The program starts with our ladies taking you on a short trip to the local village market, this is an experience by itself and here we will purchase all the fresh produce you will need for each dish then its back to our cooking school and on with the aprons . Throughout the morning you will be sampling each course as it is freshly cooked, in this way you get to try each dish as it retains it's freshness, taste and smell of herbs & spices. The whole morning is a procession of Cooking and eating, so please don't plan on going to lunch afterwards. Group sizes are limited to ensure individual tutoring and the school is busy so it is always advisable to book well ahead.
strTitle: Pick Fresh Produce and Learn to Cook Balinese-style

strIntroduction: Participants will learn how to play the famous Balinese Gamelan, a high-spirited and energetic ensemble. Participants will given a brief introduction about the Balinese Culture, Balinese music and dance, and then a hands on experience of playing one of the instruments: the gangsa.
strTitle: Learn to Play the Balinese Gamelan
